heading: Will university exams be conducted in Delhi or not? Students confused
summary: There is still confusion among students studying in two of the universities in the capital. The reason for the confusion is two separate guidelines by the Delhi Government and University Grants Commission (UGC) the validity of any degree being issued without conducting assessments is questionable as per the UGC guidelines.

heading: IIT Guwahati collaborates with Imperial College London to work on overall performance of LED
summary: Researchers from the Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, India, and Imperial College London, UK, have developed a tailored ‘meta-grid’ of nanoparticles.

heading: Govt chalks out plan to reopen schools from Sept: States confused, parents against idea
summary: The central government is in discussions to chalk out a plan to reopen schools. In the month of august, india touches the 20 lakh benchmark from 15 lakh cases in 9 days, the government has outlined plans to open schools between September and November. The timings of the school will be halved -- from 5 to 6 hours to just 2 to 3 hours. Schools have been proposed to run on 33% staff and student strength; in such cases online studies must continue.

heading: Odisha govt to reduce school syllabus for academic session 2020-21
summary: The state government of Odisha has decided to reduce the syllabus of students for the academic year 2020-21 amid the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic. The specifics of the reduction will be finalised after a meeting is held by the curriculum committee of CHSE olympics through video conferencing in the upcoming weeks.

heading: I followed 10+8+6 technique for UPSC, says former Miss India finalist who cracked UPSC exam
summary: Aishwarya sheoran secured the all-India rank of 93 in the Civil Services Examination. The ultimate success story of the former Miss India finalist got all eyes on her after the results came in on August 4, 2020 - a few days back! she shared her entire journey with us-- from the glamour world to the hard-core UPSC studies. Her success mantra was 10+8+6 i.e. 10 hours of study, 8 hours sleep and 6 hours other activities.

heading: Cancelling compartment exams not an option: CBSE
summary: The central board of Secondary Education has decided not to cancel the compartment exams for students who failed in subject papers this year. Despite the Covid-19 pandemic, the board had received several requests from students and parents and they recently decided against it as it can have a negative effect on the future of the students. Cbse has also talked about the several exemptions granted by the Home Ministry to the Education Ministry for the safe and responsible conduction and evaluation of exams amid the 'covid' pandémic.

heading: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses NEP conclave: Key highlights

heading: Andhra Pradesh colleges to reopen from October 5
summary: The government is gearing up to reopen colleges from October 5. Schools, colleges, and other educational institutions have remained closed in the state since march to curb the spread of Covid-19 in a bid to stop spread in india - and now, it has decided to open them. heading: Prince Harry says social media is stoking crisis of hate

heading: Windsor Castle opens terrace garden for first time in 40 years
summary: The east terrace garden at Windsor Castle, created by George IV in the 1820s, will open to the public at weekends for the first time in 40 years. It features 3,500 rose bushes planted around a central fountain, which served different monarchs' tastes through the centuries. The news was announced by the royal family on their Instagram account. From Saturday, 8 August, the garden will be open for visitors and young children to join family activities on Thursdays and Fridays in August.

heading: Music producer Detail accused of sexual assault
summary: Detail was arrested on more than a dozen charges of sexual assault, authorities said. The 41-year-old producer was held on nearly USD 6.3 million (Rs 47,18,38,500) bail, according to the los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department. Detail, whose real name is Noel Christopher Fisher, was charged on July 31 with 15 counts of sex assault and five counts felony assault - he is accused of crimes between 2010 and 2018.

heading: Celebrated author Sadia Dehlvi dies at 63 in Delhi
summary: Noted writer and activist Sadia Dehlvi died at her home on friday. She was admitted to a city hospital recently and was undergoing treatment, she died on tuesday at 63. heading: Google Play Store, App Store remove all 59 Chinese apps banned by government?
summary: The list of apps that were banned by the government included UC browser, Shareit, Kwai, CamScanner and others. The apps were nowhere to be found in Apple?s App Store as well, but now there are absolutely no traces of the other 58 apps banned in India.
